alert.note: Alert for Lonoke; Pulaski (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 11 at 8:21PM CDT until April 11 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...TORNADO EMERGENCY FOR OLMSTEAD AND LITTLE ROCK AIR FORCE BASE!... ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN LONOKE...SOUTHEASTERN FAULKNER AND NORTHEASTERN PULASKI COUNTIES... At 819 PM CDT, a confirmed large and destructive tornado was located over Olmstead, or near Little Rock AFB, moving east at 25 mph. TORNADO EMERGENCY for OLMSTEAD AND LITTLE ROCK AIR FORCE BASE! This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. TAKE COVER NOW! HAZARD...Deadly tornado. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be destroyed. Considerable damage to homes, businesses, and vehicles is likely and complete destruction is possible. Locations impacted include... North Little Rock... Sherwood... Jacksonville... Cabot... Lonoke... Little Rock AFB... Ward... Austin in Lonoke County... Old Austin... Parnell... Gibson... Gravel Ridge... Sylvan Hills... Sylvania... South Bend... Olmstead... Camp Robinson... Macon... Cato... Furlow... This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 168 and 173. Interstate 440 near mile marker 14. US Highway 67 between mile markers 6 and 23. TORNADO...OBSERVED TORNADO DAMAGE THREAT...CATASTROPHIC MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a large, extremely dangerous, and potentially deadly tornado is on the ground. To protect your life, TAKE COVER NOW! Move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If in a mobile home, a vehicle or outdoors, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
